title: Basic assumption of definition of groupthink

content.question: A basic assumption underlying the definition of groupthink is that

choices.label: more reasonable decisions are made by groups than by individuals
group members desire peace and harmony within the group
group members are primarily interested in their own advancement within the group
decisions made by groups of people tend to be more extreme than those made by individuals

content.answer: group members desire peace and harmony within the group

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
